channel.title: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!
channel.description:
Hey guys,I just wanted to try to solve my problem by asking you guys. A while back I wanted to start a RSPS,and so I did. Now,I have the basic's down. I have PortForwarded(43594) Got a No-ip DannySkapez.no-ip.org for host. Got a source(317-377) Now,I have spent a long time coding The Source,and I'm not giving up now. What happens is,I can log in,but when I put the Client download link up, My friends cannotlog on. Now,I'm EXTREMELY new to coding,Like Iv'e been coding for about a week but I learn fast. So I know that the problem is in the Client folder,under GUI,the IP,I have no idea what I should set it to,My IP,My no-ip,or to 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 There is also my source/files folder,and I need to change the IP in the "server" files,and I don't know what I should put in their either.There is also another file that needs an IP changed in the Client.java class under the Source/files. IF you can help me I would SO GREATLY APRECIATE IT!!! Thanks For Reading! :cool:
What I have So Far:
Under Source Files:The Ports are 43594,and the Default port is 43594,So I soppose that is right.ALSO,under the source files,there is a client notepad,And in there the IP is set to My no-ip,Correct me if I am wrong please.
Secondly,
My Client Folder:
There is ONLY The GUI,and THE IP IN THERE IS MY NO-IP! AND ALSO,there was something set to port off,so I switched it to 43594. CORRECT ME IF I AM WRONG PLEASE
Thank you!

item.title: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!
item.dc:creator: @Ploxxies Ploxxies
item.description:
@Ploxxies wrote:

You can try letting them connect to your external IP. If that doesn’t work then it’s most likely a port forwarding issue.

Read full topic
item.source: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!

item.title: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

[quote=“fatmom78, post:12, topic:385358”]THE CLIENT YOU USE should connect to 127.0.0.1

THE CLIENT OTHER PEOPLE USE should connect to DannySkapez.no-ip.org

so copy your client and have one for yourself and one for other people

example:
Danny’s Client – the ip should be 127.0.0.1

DannySkapez Client – ip should be dannyskapez.no-ip.org

Hope this helps! :)[/quote]

^^CORRECT!
Rule 2:
Everybody is equal, don’t treat people worse than you do others(E.G., don’t isolate someone and flame them).

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,354311.0.html

Read full topic
item.source: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!

item.title: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!
item.dc:creator: @droidmobile droidmobile@yahoo.com
item.description:
@droidmobile wrote:

Ok this is how you do it man.

Go to canyouseeme.org, at the bottom it will say “Yes” we can see you on “ip%%%%%%” if it says “no” we cant see you on this ip “$$##$##$#”

The go back to no-ip.com, manage your hosts, and put the ip in your host that it told you it was looking for you on @ canyouseeme.org

Read full topic
item.source: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!

item.title: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:19, topic:385358”][quote author=Liquid Magic link=topic=481111.msg3552608#msg3552608 date=1301631019]

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=481111.msg3552596#msg3552596 date=1301630683]

Stop spoon feeding the idiot, i saw the answer in there 4 times at least. if he cant get it, he dosent deserve to own a rsps… --Yes this is my day to troll lol
[/quote]the recent posts you’ve made have really revealed your arrogant side. as I have skimmed through them, I noticed how intellectually equivalent you are to the average mentally-disabled loon.

Oh, how so? because i don’t care to use correct punctuation or spell correctly? or maybe its the fact i don’t know much about coding and try the best i can? Theres also the fact that people like to ask the STUPIDEST fucking questions on hear that i could get 1000 hits for in the search bar. Now stop getting off topic and either help the dude or GTFO mopar
[/quote]despite whatever you just said (because I could care less) – it’s just because you’re completely clueless and I advise you seek serious help.

CLueles about what? how your an idiot and don’t know anything? or that your just doing this to see how mad i will get? are you seriously that low that you try and make kids on the internet on some forums that are ment to HELP people make a game mad? I hope you are proud of yourself you stupid moron… because your plan didn;t work… i dont get mad that easy…[/quote]
Fuck off, you really don’t have a clue how things work around here.

Read full topic

item.title: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!
item.dc:creator: @Ceres Ceres
item.description:
@Ceres wrote:

Jesus christ people, I know this isn’t a spoon feeding community but he just wants to know exactly where to put what IP. If you want other players to connect to your server, edit the client your going to give them. And under Client.java in your client source files change all 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 to your NO-IP.

EDIT: Also if you have a GUI.java change all 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 to your NO-IP.

Read full topic
item.source: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!

item.title: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!
item.dc:creator: @fatmom78 fatmom78
item.description:
@fatmom78 wrote:

THE CLIENT YOU USE should connect to 127.0.0.1

THE CLIENT OTHER PEOPLE USE should connect to DannySkapez.no-ip.org

so copy your client and have one for yourself and one for other people

example:
Danny’s Client – the ip should be 127.0.0.1

DannySkapez Client – ip should be dannyskapez.no-ip.org

Hope this helps!

Read full topic
item.source: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!

item.title: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

If you’re localhost you can still log in with your No-IP address.

@OP: Check your ports both on the client and server are the same. Check the IP is the correct IP that you have set-up from No-IP and that your No-IP is turned on and the lights are all returning green (make sure you have the hostname checked).

Then check your firewall and anti-virus, disable them or make exceptions.

Then lastly go to http://canyouseeme.org/ to check if you are infact broadcasting out to the internets.

Read full topic
item.source: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!

ive been coding for a good deal of time and I cant get mine online ive got the same problem
as him something todo with switching to win 7 server runs beautifuly client runs gr8 but what good is that when no one can connect =( im not sure what my problem is

item.title: My RSPS Won't Let People Log On!

item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Hey guys,I just wanted to try to solve my problem by asking you guys.
A while back I wanted to start a RSPS,and so I did.
Now,I have the basic’s down.
I have PortForwarded(43594)
Got a No-ip DannySkapez.no-ip.org for host.
Got a source(317-377)
Now,I have spent a long time coding The Source,and I’m not giving up now.
What happens is,I can log in,but when I put the Client download link up,
My friends cannotlog on.
Now,I’m EXTREMELY new to coding,Like Iv’e been coding for about a week but I learn fast.
So I know that the problem is in the Client folder,under GUI,the IP,I have no idea what I should set it to,My IP,My no-ip,or to 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1
There is also my source/files folder,and I need to change the IP in the “server” files,and I don’t know what I should put in their either.There is also another file that needs an IP changed in the Client.java class under the Source/files.
IF you can help me I would SO GREATLY APRECIATE IT!!!
Thanks For Reading!

What I have So Far:

Under Source Files:The Ports are 43594,and the Default port is 43594,So I soppose that is right.ALSO,under the source files,there is a client notepad,And in there the IP is set to My no-ip,Correct me if I am wrong please.

Secondly,

My Client Folder:

There is ONLY The GUI,and THE IP IN THERE IS MY NO-IP!
AND ALSO,there was something set to port off,so I switched it to 43594.
CORRECT ME IF I AM WRONG PLEASE

Thank you!
